str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From ek and klino; to deviate, i.e. to shun, or to decline.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From achreios; to render useless, i.e. Spoil.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Goodness, uprightness, kindness, gentleness. From chrestos; usefulness, i.e. Morally, excellence.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
